data.name: changeslog1.Text
data.value:
=========================== <<<<<<< HEAD =======V2.1.0 CHANGELOG======== =========================== ALLIES - Gave it a new coat of paint. - Added way to set location of target cursor arrow and ABXY - Added level-up calculator to total the sum of level-up increments and show which spells are learned when. - Fixed Clear clearing exp needed to level up when clearing a character - Updated HelpTips
MAIN TITLE - Added title preview - Can edit the locations for Exor, background, main title, and credits for both first boot-up title and after Exor title - Can force the game to use the first boot title or the alternate Exor title
ATTACKS - Fixed Damage Calculator to only have one window open at a time
TOOLS - Previewer: Added way to switch out Mario - Graphics Editor: Fixed bug where backup GFX would overwrite current GFX if the window open, then closed on another sprite index - Restore: Included .SFC/.BAK file types to open - Restore: Reworked Menus (again). Reassembles compressed data just like Menus editor does, instead of just copying chunks of data over. - Restore: Fixed bug where opening a subeditor before would not update the subeditor with the new restored changes - Hex Editor: Fixed crash when opening, typing in the searchBox, closing, then reopening - Tile Editor: Updated toolbar - Graphics Editor: Updated toolbar - Palette Editor: Updated toolbar
MAIN - Included file type to open "SMRPG ROM Backup (*.BAK)"
MENUS - Fixed reload/closing ROM calling function Close(), causing the sub-editor not to close - Fixed Star Pieces assets from not resetting when closing the editor - Fixed Game Select Background palette carrying over from ROMs - Added reset button - Added tile editor - Fixed banner palette being glitched in Preview - Probably fixed more stuff here, but didn't write it down
MONSTERS - Fixed stats from updating by switching the monster's index after typing in a new stat value
PROJECT NOTES - Removed ROM name from notes - No longer asks for ROM name. Instead, it checks to see if the note's file name matches the ROM's file name, and asks if it's ok to load. - Fixed Allies not working - Added hotkey Ctrl+S to save - Fixed project notes file always loading without option being checked in Settings. - The above change also fixes a few other bugs when updating labels.
ITEMS - Shops: Fixed last index not displaying "/// NOTHING ///"
=========================== ======= >>>>>>> 7ba2f053f00c168cf1777d310b87e68341c36183 =======V2.0.1 CHANGELOG======== =========================== ATTACKS - Fixed Berserk status in Monster Attacks not applying correctly
=========================== =======V2.0.0 CHANGELOG======== =========================== MAIN - Updated icons across all editors (using LS4.0 icons+outsourced+custom) --LS 4.0 icons by giangurgolo --New icons outsourced from led24.de/iconset/ --New icons outsourced from fatcow.com/free-icons --New icons outsourced from p.yusukekamiyamane.com/ --New, custom icons by Yaki --- (All LS 3.19.0 icons still in solution on Github) - Added jumbo icons layout option -- As a bonus, can hold "alt" to drag+drop editor icons on main editor window - Fixed "Close ROM" not closing the HEX editor - Fixed "Project Database" not asking to save if closing full editor - Ally name changes are reflected in lists - Updated toolbar layout across all editors -- Help, Base Converter, and window changing icons are on the right of the toolbar - Included ".SFC" ROM file types to be loaded/saved - Error message window Abort Application now always closes editor (credit jpmac26) - Updated .NET Framework from 2.0 to 4.8 - Updated readme.xml
TOOLS - Palette Editor: Fixed throw for HTML, either not being hex, or being greater than $F8F8F8 - Palette Editor: Fixed window resolution being slightly smaller than intended - Graphics Editor: Fixed not being able to reset or undo because palette editor was updated - ZoomBox: Fixed being able to close it using Alt-F4 in Sprites. - Hex Editor: Fixed "Jump To Offset" jumping to offset prior to the one searched for - Hex Editor: Added way to search backwards or forwards from offset - Hex Editor: Added button to highlight recent changes in ROM - Hex Editor: Added buttons to jump (forwards or backwards) to recent changes in ROM - Restore: Menus now includes imports for just Text, Graphics, Tilesets, and Misc.
PREVIEWER - Rerouted all PreviewROMs to the emulator path. (ZSNES typically likes to have all saves in a certain folder as it, a setting it defaults to) - Fixed editor generating a backup for PreviewROMs - Added previewer for Sprites and Effects editors - Added warning if no emulator is selected
PROJECT DATABASE - Fixed error where file is "being used by another process" if notes were loaded then saved - Fixed editor buttons not becoming disabled if there were no notes loaded - Added warning for "Close Project" button - Fixed bug with "Close Project" button where the file directory would not reset, causing errors - Added "Reload Project Database" to refresh notes for any reason - Added Auto-Update feature
PATCHES - Now works! Explore ROM patches in a sleek layout, and patch your ROM on-the-fly if you desire. (Just make sure to backup your ROM before patching!) - Host server is Yaki's github by default. Can use one or several sites to connect to. => Instructions on how to host your own patch server is in the default patch server link on github - Added HelpTips to Patches
LEVELS - Added "Solidity Flat Mode" (Hotkey "R"). Flat Mode reduces the height of all tiles to zero so you can actually see what you're doing. - Updated color codes for solidity tiles - Added new color codes on solidity tiles for Stairs, Doors, Conveyerbelts - Corrected icons for Solid Mods and Tile Mods - Made Priority1 yellow on Solidity Tiles transparent at while opacity set to 100% - Fixed bug where editor would not ask to save if changing area music only then closing - Added Palette offset under "?" level info icon - Renamed a couple levels to more accurately describe them
ATTACKS - Fixed "Damage Modifiers" box not disappearing for non-ally spells - Changed "Clear element" option to reset to NONE (instead of just zero) - Added checkbox for unused Berserk status (doesn't work unless ASM enables it)
ITEMS - Added feature to change how a list sorts itself (Alphabetically, w/ or w/out icons, and sorts DUMMY to the bottom) - Changed "Clear element" option to reset to NONE (instead of just zero) - Added checkbox for unused Berserk status (doesn't work unless ASM enables it) - Renamed "Element Weaknesses" to "Element Halving" - Ally names in Checkboxes update to the ally names in the ROM - Updated HelpTips to reflect new changes
ANIMATIONS - Changed command list to have hex number prefix, instead of decimal -- Additionally for the list, removed names for unused commands - Fixed "Timing for single button inputs" (0xCE, 0xCF) from reversing params when hitting apply - Added blue color highlight for Jump to Address commands (0xCE, 0xCF, 0xD0, 0xD8) - Fixed potential crash selecting command menu child (like Monster's list) for the first time
BATTLEFIELDS - Added "Show/Hide Allies (P)" button, similar to the button in FORMATIONS editor - Added "Screen" button to display a SNES resolution screen (256 x 224) - Fixed bug where copying a selection, then changing battlefield #, would paste the selection in the prior battlefield
DIALOGUES - Fixed dialogues from saving incorrectly, corrupting them. (Thank you Doomsday31415!) - Fixed bug where going above index 5 (or something) in battle messages would break the UI
EVENTS - Fixed Edit Label window not writing to event label - Added more event names, including complete list of "Intro Demo" (Courtesy of Sukasa of now-defunct Acmlm Kafuka BoardII)
FORMATIONS - Fixed preview ally portraits from being mirrored horizonally
MENUS - Can now edit Foreground and Background using tools found in other editors - Added "Overworld Menu - Star Pieces" to view and edit palettes and tilesets for this menu - Added editable overworld menu list - Fixed bug where menu palettes would carry over from previously loaded ROMs. - Updated HelpTips to reflect new changes
MONSTERS - Fixed typo in battle scripts "Set Target Invicibilty"
WORLD MAPS - Added edit-able Sprite Graphics (yippie!) - Added edit-able Sprite Palettes (yippie!!) - Mario's Overworld sprite can be previewed by clicking the Banners button - Fixed bug where tile editing was enabled when Banners and/or Locations were on
SPRITES - Updated the following names: 97 - "Toadstool's Parachute" -> "Snifit's Parachute" 135 - "Mine Cart (bad palette)" -> "Mine Cart (Seq7 Overworld Sprite)" 144 - "Red Dot?" -> "Apple (Yo'ster Isle intro sequence)" 174- "Small Candy Cloud" -> "Mario on Nimbus Busman (Bowser's Keep cutscene)" 222 - "banana peel" -> "Toadstool Marrymore Accessories" 521 - "light blue stars" -> "Battle stars (on hit)" 526 - "yellow mist / stream" -> "Geno's Star Form (Ending Credits)" 527 - "yellow mist / stream forms into small star" -> "Geno's Bullets and Star Gun" 786 - "Wind Crystal" -> "Wind Crystal and Fire Crystal" 789 - "Water Crystal" -> "Water Crystal and Earth Crystal" 956 - "normal yellow 5-pronged star" -> "Geno in Star Form (Ending Credits)" 957 - "brown object dissipating" -> "The End background (Ending Credits)" 958 -> "tiny glowing pixel" -> "Geno's Star's glow effect (Ending Credits)"
=========================== =======V1.3.2 CHANGELOG======= =========================== MONSTERS - Fixed flower bonus % not saving
=========================== =======V1.3.1 CHANGELOG======= =========================== MAIN - Updated all icons to those of Lazy Shell 4.0.0 - File path for ROM now shows just the ROM file's name. (Click the ROM file name to reveal full path)
ANIMATIONS - Added Weapon Timed-Hit Sounds (for when a weapon is timed correctly) - Added Character Weapon Scripts (for when characters draw near to attack a monster)
=========================== =======V1.3.0 CHANGELOG======= =========================== ANIMATIONS - Added documentation of Ally button inputs, used by opcodes CC, CD, CE, CF, D0, D1, D2, D3, D4, D8.
ATTACKS - Removed being able to edit the timings for certain ally spells. (i.e. Super Jump, Bowser Crush, etc) - In place of that, added ability to change the timing of any ally spell and their damage properties.
=========================== =======V1.2.8 CHANGELOG======= =========================== ANIMATIONS - Changed length displayed for commands A7 and DB.
=========================== =======V1.2.7 CHANGELOG======= =========================== DIALOGUES - Resolved Battle Menu GFX editor displaying the wrong tiles.
=========================== =======V1.2.6 CHANGELOG======= =========================== ANIMATIONS - At 0xD5: Added formation position #, fixed bug - At 0x00: Removed "use palette row 4", added "Palette Row #" value - A5 0x96: Battle Messages can now be set above 6
MONSTERS - Clearing a Monster's Stats will reset win items and Yoshi cookie to the correct value
=========================== =======V1.2.5 CHANGELOG======= =========================== EVENTS - Changed "$70Ax = $7xxx" to "$70Ax = $7000" due to mislabel - Increased length of HEX display at the bottom - Added "(NOT including {xx})" to randomized number codes. - Changed description of 3A and 3B commands to be more accurate
FORMATIONS - Clearing a formation will set the event # to 102 (from 0) and music to CURRENT (from Normal)
=========================== =======V1.2.4 CHANGELOG======= =========================== MAIN - Increased height of search box results
ANIMATIONS - Fixed bug with monster behavior scripts
ITEMS - Added hex editor next to item index
=========================== =======V1.2.3 CHANGELOG======= =========================== MAIN - Added original SMRPG Documents by giangurgolo, updated by Yakibomb
ANIMATIONS - At 0xD5: Fixed Summon monster display - Added numerals next to opcodes
EVENTS - Removed numerals from sound lists
=========================== =======V1.2.2 CHANGELOG======= =========================== ANIMATIONS - Added new scripts: Faint, Run Away and Victory (under Monster Behavior #1-3)
EVENTS - To Open menu commands: Added "close menu and refresh VRAM" and now script displays what menu/event will run
=========================== =======V1.2.1 CHANGELOG======= =========================== EVENTS - Switched Memory commands $7xxxx = $7xxxx because it was confusing to read
=========================== =======V1.2.0 CHANGELOG======= =========================== AUDIO - Changed names of event sounds and battle sounds
ANIMATIONS - At 0xD5: Added undocumented Summon Monster - Added ability to select and edit unused DUMMY spells for allies - Changed the ability to select sounds and music using an index number - Removed the numbers from the left of the sound list (for faster searching) - At 0x00: added undocumented "behind all sprites" and "overlap all sprites" properties
EVENTS - Fixed bug where "If Memory $704x [x @ 7000] bit {xx} clear..." auto-jumped to another command - Fixed bug where "Shadow On" was unselectable - Added undocumented 3A and 3B commands: Jump to if object is less than x tiles close to Mario
=========================== =======V1.1.0 CHANGELOG======= =========================== EVENTS - Switched joypad commands descriptions in category list - Updated parameters for "Display pre-game intro title..." to display correctly in the editor script
======================== =======V1.0.0 RELEASE======= ======================== MAIN -Changed file icon for LazyShell -Changed the ABOUT LAZY SHELL... to this editor's changelog
ANIMATIONS - Added ability to edit Flower Bonus Messages, Toad's Battle Tutorial and Weapon Miss Sounds - Added ability to select and edit unused DUMMY spells for allies
EVENTS - Added undocumented bit 7 of Run Background Event... as "Run as second script" - Added move script thread commands under category "Events" - Added undocumented commands to walk and transfer to Memory $7016-1B - Added undocumented "Play sound (ch4.5.) ..."
LEVELS - Added undocumented commands {B2,b4} and {B3,b0} as "Can't enter doors" and "Can't walk up stairs".
ITEMS - Added new attribute: "Add stats (item)"
WORLD MAPS - Added ability to view (not edit) Mario's map sprite

data.name: richTextBox3.Text
data.value:
LAZYSHELL++, based off source code of Lazy Shell v3.19.0 Source code and software maintained 2021-2025, by Yaki
Lazy Shell, and Lazy Shell's source code, Copyright Â© 2007-2013 giangurgolo & Omega
Yaki's Special Thanks Pidgezero_one, SMRPG Randomizer Team - Feedback, bug finders Doomsday31415 - Released source code to fix Dialogues editor save corruptions Will319 - Positive feedback, bug finder, feature requests (flat mode in particular) jpmac26 - For their LazyShell 4.0 source code fork AnAxemRanger - Bug finder, positive feedback
Lazy Shell's Main Contributors and Supporters:
ElementalPowerStar - notable donator, principle bug-finder, positive feedback Yaki - principle bug-finder and tester, positive feedback Ryan H. - donator, supporter
Special Thanks: Alex Farber - MRU list manager Bregalad - source code for BRR encoding and decoding CrispyYoshi - feedback, beta testing, documentation for audio editor FuSoYa - for permission to use Lunar Compress.dll Kevin Weiner - animated GIF encoder class KP9000 - beta testing, discovered many bugs with pre-release version MathOnNapkins - helped with some coding Serge Meunier - image processing function code spel werdz rite - original resolution for running program under a 64-bit OS romhacking community - various feedback
